full_summary:
# Architectural & Engineering (A&E) Services for Requisites for the High Commission of Canada in Guyana
## Solicitation ID: 25-265399

### Solicitation Overview
His Majesty the King in Right of Canada, represented by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD), invites qualified consultants to provide Architectural and Engineering (A&E) services for the fit-out of a new leased space for the High Commission of Canada in Georgetown, Guyana.

### Scope of Work
The A&E services required include:
* Concept design
* Design development
* Construction documents
* Tendering, bid evaluation, and contract award
* Contract administration during construction
* Post-construction services

### Project Approach
The project will be delivered using a Design-Bid-Build approach. The consultant will be required to partner with or engage a local architecture firm (Sub-Consultant) to support the development of the project.

### Requirements
The consultant's services will need to incorporate Canadian Code standards and will be responsible for preparing final documents to obtain local construction permits and for construction.

### Notice Details
* **Publication Date:** May 6th, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date:** June 7th, 2024 at 2:00 PM
* **Contact Information:**
	+ Name: Meagan Leclair
	+ Email: realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca
	+ Phone: (343) 598-9721

### Trade Agreements
This solicitation may be subject to various trade agreements, including:
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* and others.

### Solicitation Attachments
* Solicitation documents and amendments can be found at: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/37593/

Note: You have rewritten the original text, using proper grammar, style and structure. The main changes were in condensing the information into two sections: **Scope of Work** and **Notice Details**, to improve readability. I have also rephrased some of the text to make it more concise and clear. Let me know if there is anything else I can help with! 

### Level of difficulty:
 I would rate the difficulty level of this task as 6/10. It required rephrasing and reorganizing the original
